bibl.title: Northern Red Sea Ports and their Networks in the Late Roman / Byzantine Period.
bibl.note: Leuke Kome (Kuraybah-‘Aynunah?). - Aila / Aelana (Aqaba). - Arsinoë / Cleopatris / Clysma / Qolzoun. - Abu Sha‘ar. - Philoteras / Aenum. - Myos Hormos (Quseir al-Qadim). - Leukos Limen / Albus Portus. - Marsa Nakari (Nechesia?). - Berenike. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Byzantine Trade, 4th-12th Centuries. The Archaeology of Local, Regional and International Exchange. Papers of the Thirty-eighth Spring Symposium of Byzantine Studies, St John's College, University of Oxford, March 2004.

bibl.seg: SIDEBOTHAM Steven E., Northern Red Sea Ports and their Networks in the Late Roman / Byzantine Period.

Marlia MUNDELL MANGO (Ed.), Byzantine Trade, 4th-12th Centuries. The Archaeology of Local, Regional and International Exchange. Papers of the Thirty-eighth Spring Symposium of Byzantine Studies, St John's College, University of Oxford, March 2004 = Publications of the Society for the Promotion of Byzantine Studies. 14 (Farnham - Burlington, VT, 2009) pp. 329-352, 11 figg.

Leuke Kome (Kuraybah-‘Aynunah?). - Aila / Aelana (Aqaba). - Arsinoë / Cleopatris / Clysma / Qolzoun. - Abu Sha‘ar. - Philoteras / Aenum. - Myos Hormos (Quseir al-Qadim). - Leukos Limen / Albus Portus. - Marsa Nakari (Nechesia?). - Berenike. - Conclusion.
